com.linkedin.parseq

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linkedin.parseq.Engine

  • public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that can run a set Tasks. Use EngineBuilder to create Engine instances.
    Author:
    Chris Pettitt (cpettitt@linkedin.com)

    • Method Detail

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String key)

      • run

        public void run(Task<?> task)
        Runs the given task with its own context. Use Tasks.seq and Tasks.par to create and run composite tasks.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to run

      • run

        public void run(Task<?> task,
                java.lang.String planClass)
        Runs the given task with its own context. Use Tasks.seq and Tasks.par to create and run composite tasks.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to run

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        If the engine is currently running, this method will initiate an orderly shutdown. No new tasks will be accepted, but already running tasks will be allowed to finish. Use awaitTermination(int, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) to wait for the engine to shutdown.

        If the engine is already shutting down or stopped this method will have no effect.

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Returns true if engine shutdown has been started or if the engine is terminated. Use isTerminated() to determine if the engine is actually stopped and awaitTermination(int, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) to wait for the engine to stop.
        Returns:
        true if the engine has started shutting down or if it has finished shutting down.

      • isTerminated

        public boolean isTerminated()
        Returns true if the engine has completely stopped. Use awaitTermination(int, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) to wait for the engine to terminate. Use shutdown() to start engine shutdown.
        Returns:
        true if the engine has completed stopped.

      • awaitTermination

        public boolean awaitTermination(int time,
                                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for the engine to stop. Use shutdown() to initiate shutdown.
        Parameters:
        time - the amount of time to wait
        unit - the unit for the time to wait
        Returns:
        true if shutdown completed within the specified time or false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting for the engine to stop.
